definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: He was supposed to ask her out, but he punked out at the last minute.
sentences.chinese: 他本該邀請她出去，可是到最後他卻沒膽量請了。

sentences.english: This guy makes more money than god and you have the outright audacity to ignore what he has to say.
sentences.chinese: 他家財萬貫，而且你絕對有膽量忽略他所說的。

sentences.english: He is much happier talking about courage than compassion.
sentences.chinese: 於是，他更喜歡談“膽量”，不擅長與你侃“憐憫”。

sentences.english: You can even get behind bars in one of the cells, if you dare.
sentences.chinese: 如果有膽量，你可以進到裏面體驗一把坐牢的感覺。

sentences.english: Hey guys n gals try this if u have guts to score high n high.
sentences.chinese: 嘿傢伙列印囡囡嘗試，如果有膽量的得分高N高。

sentences.english: Who is there here with a bold heart? Who will plant the flag on the barricade again?
sentences.chinese: 這兒誰有膽量再把這面紅旗插到街壘上去？

sentences.english: The money so much a heterosexuality to feel again we beautiful man but have no courage.
sentences.chinese: 人好有錢是異性戀又覺得我們漂亮的男人卻又沒膽量。

sentences.english: I can't believe you actually have courage to eat New Orleans drumstick for your low salary.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信你確實有膽量喫你的低工資新奧爾良雞腿。

sentences.english: Check out the betel-nut stand near the corner, and try some if you dare.
sentences.chinese: 如果你夠膽量，就試試角落裏的那家檳榔攤。

sentences.english: Battle is the most magnificent competition in which a human being can indulge.
sentences.chinese: 戰鬥是不甘居人下的男子漢最能表現自己膽量的競爭。

sentences.english: With it went the last vestiges of my courage.
sentences.chinese: 隨之而去的還有我最後的那一絲膽量。

sentences.english: "And I should get no courage, " said the Cowardly Lion.
Conspirators have a logic and a daring beyond our reach.
sentences.chinese: 而陰謀者的邏輯和膽量都是我們所不及的。

sentences.english: It takes a bit of nerve to cross these chain bridges.
sentences.chinese: 過這種鐵鎖橋要有點膽量纔行。

sentences.english: Love has been perfected among us in this: that we may have boldness.
sentences.chinese: 愛在我們中間以這樣的方式完美，我們會有膽量。

sentences.english: The little boy was game enough to swim across the river.
sentences.chinese: 這小男孩膽量大，勇於遊過河去。

definition: to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to surpass others/outstanding/(basketball, soccer etc) to get past an opponent
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
